comments.body: and this shows problem with such generic module, user MUST know api to know what is returned

No, this is not a problem. User needs to know the API regardless as they need to know the data format. Just having description of high level field names is not enough.

 This is a module that is a proxy for calling all Avi REST API which do not have an object behind them like GET analytics, status etc

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +123,127 @@    description: Avi REST resource
    returned: success, changed
    type: dict
'''

comments.body: What would be needed to support check mode? Idempotent modules is one of Ansible's key features

It does support impotency fully. However, it does not support module_check as a dry-run because of limitation on Avi API which do not have a dry-run option. Checking will alter state on the Avi controllers.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +5,9 @@# @author: Gaurav Rastogi (grastogi@avinetworks.com) GitHub ID: grastogi23
#
# module_check: not supported
#
# This file is part of Ansible
